word: The Father wrought by His Son in the creation of all heavenly beings. “By him were all things created . . . whether they be thrones, or dominions, or principalities, or powers: all things were created by him, and for him.” . . . The Son, the anointed of God, the “express image of his person,”“the brightness of his glory,”“upholding all things by the word of his power,” holds supremacy over them all. . . .
